isis.stitle: CAB: 7000 AND 8000 SERIES MODELS - REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION - Cab Doors

svcprocinfo.para: Front and rear cab doors are removed and installed nearly the same way. The only difference is the removal and installation of the rear B-pillar trim panel, which is noted in the procedures where necessary.

item.para: Removal procedures show passenger side; driver side procedures are the same.

The cab doors are of welded, all-steel construction and are mounted on hinges located on the hinge pillars. Door adjustment is provided by enlarged holes in the door hinges. The door check stops are located just below the upper hinges on the door hinge pillars. The door latch striker pin is also adjustable on the door lock pillar.

step1.para: Remove wiring harness rubber boot from the cab hinge pillar.

3. ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK CONNECTOR

note.para: Graphic shows front door electrical connectors; rear door electrical connectors may be slightly different.

step1.para:
For rear cab doors only, remove B-pillar trim panel. Refer to
B-PILLAR TRIM PANEL
.

For rear cab doors only, remove scuff plate and seat belt retractor cover. Refer to
SCUFF PLATE AND SEAT BELT RETRACTOR COVER
.
Locate cab door wiring harness (below the instrument panel, under left side of steering wheel) and pull cab door wiring harness down to access electrical connectors.
Disconnect the three electrical connectors (lighted or heated or electric mirror; CB radio; and electric window and door locks) as equipped.
Secure a sling or padded chain to the top of the window frame and attach to an overhead hoist to support the door.
Remove stop pin from link and bracket.
Remove four mounting nuts with washers from threaded studs.
With door supported from overhead hoist, move door slightly backward to disengage threaded studs from hinges.
Carefully pull the wiring harness and electrical connectors through the cab hinge pillar.
Using the overhead hoist, move cab door to a padded work bench.

note.para: Installation procedures show passenger side; driver side procedures are the same.

step1.para: Secure a sling or padded chain to the top of the window frame and attach to an overhead hoist to support the door.
Using the overhead hoist, lift and move the cab door near to the cab.
Carefully pull the wiring harness and electrical connectors into and through the cab hinge pillar.
Move door slightly forward to engage threaded studs into the hinges.
Install four mounting nuts with washers onto the threaded studs ( Figure 71, Items 4, and 8). Tighten nuts to 14 to 18 Lbf-ft (19 to 24 N•m).
Align link into bracket and insert stop pin ( Figure 71, Items 2, 5, and 6).
Push the wiring harness and electrical connectors up under the instrument panel, if applicable.

For rear cab doors only, install B-pillar trim panel. Refer to
B-PILLAR TRIM PANEL
.

For rear cab doors only, install scuff plate and seat belt retractor cover. Refer to
SCUFF PLATE AND SEAT BELT RETRACTOR COVER
.
Install wiring harness rubber boot to the cab hinge pillar ( Figure 69).
